conflictDescription: The first story requires ALFRED to listen only when the user activates push-to-talk, while the second story requires ALFRED to listen continuously without user action. These two behaviors cannot happen at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: Push-to-talk works only when the user activates it
ALFRED is always ready to respond to user commands
ALFRED does not listen without push-to-talk activation
ALFRED stays active throughout the day without user action
User feels safe and in control of ALFRED's listening
ALFRED provides continuous support without delays
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to listen only when I activate push-to-talk, so I feel safe and in control.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to be ready to respond without action, when I enable continuous listening, so I feel supported easily.
